intro: Homalobus curvicarpus, commonly known as the narrow-fruit homalobus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruits are typically elliptical and contain a single seed, contributing to its unique botanical profile. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests.
